Title.evidence: Advanced Cryotherapy vs. Cold Packs in Knee Arthroplasty: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: A priori sample size calculation determined 50 subjects per group were needed to detect a 2-point difference on the VAS with 80% power.

Participants.evidence: A total of 116 patients undergoing knee arthroplasty

Intervention.evidence: randomly allocated to receive either advanced cryotherapy (n=58) or cold packs (n=58)

Objective.evidence: evaluated the efficacy of advanced cryotherapy devices compared to cold packs in enhancing recovery after knee arthroplasty

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was postoperative pain measured by the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) and analgesic consumption, assessed over a 6-week period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 116 patients undergoing knee arthroplasty were randomly allocated

Number_Analysed.evidence: randomly allocated to receive either advanced cryotherapy (n=58) or cold packs (n=58)

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 6 weeks, no significant differences were observed in VAS scores or analgesic use between groups.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
